citations.narrative:
There are two primary enclosures in a state of disrepair. In the second outdoor run, housing one adult German Shepherd,
there is an area of the steel wall panel where the metal has become detached from the support and has curled into the
enclosure. In the same enclosure, two pieces of aluminum, used to secure the end panel to the divider panel, have curled
into the enclosure and one has become partially detached. In an additional outdoor run, housing three adult dogs, the end
of the steel wall panel has separated from the support which has exposed the insulation and rough metal. All of these
areas have created sharp, rough metal edges in the enclosures.
Failure to maintain primary enclosures can allow for sharp points or edges which can result in injury to the animals.
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points or edges that could injure the
dogs.
Correct by August 2, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
There are two primary enclosures in a state of disrepair. In the second outdoor run, housing one adult German Shepherd, 
there is an area of the steel wall panel where the metal has become detached from the support and has curled into the 
enclosure. In the same enclosure, two pieces of aluminum, used to secure the end panel to the divider panel, have curled 
into the enclosure and one has become partially detached. In an additional outdoor run, housing three adult dogs, the end 
of the steel wall panel has separated from the support which has exposed the insulation and rough metal. All of these 
areas have created sharp, rough metal edges in the enclosures.  
Failure to maintain primary enclosures can allow for sharp points or edges which can result in injury to the animals. 
Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points or edges that could injure the 
dogs.  
Correct by August 2, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
